result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodolfo Vera-Perez

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Rodolfo Vera-Perez appeared by video, in custody from DCI.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Rodolfo Vera-Perez.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  10:21 AM  Counsel asks for a breakout room with his client.  Back on the record at 10:26 AM  Defendant indicates that he wishes to reject the State's offer.  Court goes over defendant's rights and finds the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently rejects all offers and sets the matter for jury trial.  It is likely that the Defendant will be in federal custody at the time of the jury trial.  Defense counsel to let the District Attorney's office know once Mr. Vera-Perez is moved to federal custody so that a proper Writ can be prepared well before trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 8, 2023 at 08:30 am.
E-mail correspondence confirming defendant's appearance from Dodge Correctional.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:40 am.

3:36 PM Defendant Rodolfo Vera-Perez appeared by video, in custody at DCI.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Rodolfo Vera-Perez.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The State is recommending thirty (30) days jail on count 1, count 2 to be dismissed and read in. State believes the sentence is time served or asks that the sentence be concurrent to any sentence his is presently serving. 
The defendant informs the court that he wants this case dismissed completely so it is not on his record. The matter is reset. Scheduling conference set for the defendant to formally reject the offer and set the matter for trial.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - document mailed 09-06-2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:20 am.

2:35 PM Defendant Rodolfo Vera-Perez appeared by video.  Attorney Sarah Malcore for Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Rodolfo Vera-Perez.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is waiving any conflict of interest that his attorney may have for representing the co-defendant Nestor Lopez. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Scheduling conference on July 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Further proceedings on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-16-22 at 2:15 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   
Minutes.
